info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 9:38AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Arkansas River At Pendleton affecting Arkansas, Desha and Lincoln Counties.
For the Arkansas River...including Pendleton...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Arkansas River at Pendleton.
* WHEN...From Monday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Area access roads on right descending bank upstream and downstream of the bridge are flooded. Property inside the levee in the Pendeleton area is threatened and should be removed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 26.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 32.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. This is based off of future rainfall. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for updates. - Flood stage is 31.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 72 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 945 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Arkansas, AR; Desha, AR; Lincoln, AR
